StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SignOso369Eval]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@TrainingFileId uniqueidentifier, @SignUserType smallint, @UpdateUserId uniqueidentifier, @SignatureId uniqueidentifier
AS
BEGIN
SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL READ UNCOMMITTED
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF @SignUserType = 0 -- RsCo Sign BEGIN
UPDATE USMC.Mul.MonthEvalua.on SET LastUpdatedDate = GETDATE(), LastUpdatedBy = @UpdateUserId, RsCoSignature = @SignatureId, RsCoSignDate = GETDATE() WHERE TrainingFileID = @TrainingFileId
END ELSE IF @SignUserType = 1 -- Aop sign BEGIN UPDATE USMC.Mul.MonthEvalua.on SET LastUpdatedDate = GETDATE(), LastUpdatedBy = @UpdateUserId, AopSignature = @SignatureId, AopSignDate = GETDATE() WHERE TrainingFileID = @TrainingFileId
END ELSE IF @SignUserType = 2 -- Oso Sign BEGIN UPDATE USMC.Mul.MonthEvalua.on SET LastUpdatedDate = GETDATE(), LastUpdatedBy = @UpdateUserId, OsoSignature = @SignatureId, OsoSignDate = GETDATE() WHERE TrainingFileID = @TrainingFileId
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
